text: Belle du Berry (1966 – 11 August 2020) was a French singer-songwriter, and actress. She was born in Bourges, France. In 1992, she worked with Philippe Decouflé to choreograph the ballets for the opening of the 1992 Winter Olympics. She was known for being a member of the Paris Combo. In 2009, du Berry wrote a collection of new songs with David Lewis as the trumpeter and pianist. Du Berry died of cancer in Le Kremlin-Bicêtre on 11 August 2020. ==References== Category:1966 births Category:2020 deaths Category:People from Bourges Category:French movie actors Category:French singer-songwriters
title: Belle du Berry
